lines.text: So much for the weather report. I'm not the only one who just arrived. How about your trip to Berlin Stick?
It went pretty much as you figured. Now that he's the big star, I couldn't reason with him. He said he was pulling out and he threatened me.
Oh my my my my. The rest of it was in the papers. That's when he committed suicide huh? Haha!
He just got up and jumped out of the window...
You lose Carl Miller!
[last lines]
Son of a bitch! Goddamn bastard! Goddamn...!
[screams and falls]
Dr Land.
Yes?
The money is all here. Every dollar.
I'd be surprised if it weren't.
[Billy stops Ann from shooting Dr Land]
Let it go. What must be done is being done.

[referring to Ann's calling Land and Steiner murderers after Billy's death]
Rude bitch.
One rebel begats another. It's the Billy Lo syndrome.
A venereal disease. Often terminal.
You've got till tomorrow morning to call us. It's the last time we're gonna ask Billy.

[Original Dialouge]
Do you speak any Enlgish?
Of course I speak English.
I hope you don't mind if we move our man so we could have more room to groove.
But... Have your men stay as far away from the stairway as possible

[as Tien moves an unconscious Cheh out of the way Hai Tien prepares to fight with his bamboo whip]
You know baby, this bamboo is longer, more flexible and very much alive, and if your flashy routine cannot keep up with the speed and elusiveness of this thing here, all I can say is you will be in deep trouble.
That we will have to find out.

[during the fight Hai Tien gains the upper hand]
I am telling you it is difficult to have a rehearsed routine to fit in with broken rhythm
[they fight and Hai Tien hits yhe guardian again]
see, rehearsed routines, lack the flexibility to adapt.
[first lines]
Cut! Okay, that's a print. That was great, Billy! Okay everybody...
[stage light collapses, crew gasps]
